intro: Eriostemma smarense, commonly known as the Smarense eriostem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
